p:
Territory of Washington vs. David Aimesworth and J.S. Danford And now on this 5th day of February A.D. 1885. The said David Aimesworth is there tried solemnly publicly called to come into court, as by this bond or recognizance duly taken approved and filed in this court he hath under- taken to do, but wholly failed to appear in court, without sufficient cause. Whereupon, on motion of J.C. Hyde, prosecuting attorney, Macie N. Bennett, B.H. Bennett and A.N. Cannon, the parties of the said David Aimesworth, are, by order of the court there to be duly solemnly and publicly called upon to produce the said David Aimesworth there in court, which they wholly fail to do, without sufficient cause. And it fully appearing to the court that by this bond or recognizance duly made the 24th day day of November A.D. 1884, and duly taken approved and filed in this court on the 25th day of November A.D. 1884. The said David Aimesworth as principal and said Macie N. Bennett, B.H. Bennett, and A.N. Cannon have jointly and generally undertaken and bond themselves to the Territory of Washington in the sum of Six Thousand dollars, confined that if the said David Aimesworth be and appear in this court on the 2nd day of February A.D. 1885 and from day to day, and from adjournment to adjournment. and from there to there. Thereafter, and in like manner appear at any of the District court in said Territory, to which the name of said cause might be removed, there to answer, to an indictment charging said David Aimesworth with the charge of having obtained property of one M.H. Whitney, by account of false pretenses and with intent to defraud the said M.H. Whitney and to in execution of any indictment that insight be endorsed against him in said matter, there to be void, otherwise in full force. And it likewise fully appearing to the court, that the said David Aimesworth and Macie N. Bennett B.H. Bennett and A.N. Cannon, were all and each of them have violated the terms and conditions of the said bond or recognizance that the said David Aimesworth has wholly failed to appear in this court as by said bond or recognizance required to do, although duly called, and that all and each of the said parties, though duly called, have without any excuse, therefore, wholly failed and neglected to produce the said David Aimesworth in court. It is therefore now here in dated and adjudged that the default of said David Aimesworth, Macie N. Bennett, B.H. Bennett, and A.N. Cannon, and each of therein the be and is hereby called and endorsed. It is also considered and adjudged by the court. That the said bond or recognizance be and is hereby declared to be and is for failed.
E. 440 1356 Territory of Washington vs. David Aimesworth Et. al Order of affecting Bond Filed Febry. 5 1885 A. Reeves Aipes, Clerk By Warren J. Lockhart Deputy
